revised_title: An In-Depth Study of Crystal Angles and Growth
tldr: The author investigates the variation of angles observed in crystals, particularly potassium-alum and ammonium-alum, by measuring them at different stages of growth. They discovered that crystal faces are not simple indices but vicinal planes slightly inclined to them, which change their inclinations during growth. The study also found that the liquid in contact with growing crystals is slightly supersaturated and has a specific refractive index.
